shortcontents.shortcontent: I) ʾArganonä wǝddase “The Harp of Praise” (fols. 1ra-268vb), incomplete I-1) Monday (fols. 1ra-2vb, 260, 3ra-16vb, 167, 17ra-22vb, 23ra-28vb, 29ra-40ra) I-2) Tuesday (fols. 40ra-64vb, 65ra-71vb, 72ra-74vb, 75, 76ra-79vb, 80ra-81vb, 82ra-85vb, 86ra-96ra) I-3) Wednesday (fols. 96ra-101vb, 102ra-108vb, 109ra-127vb, 128, 134ra- 140vb, 94, 141ra-146vb, 149ra-150vb, 153ra) I-4) Thursday (fols. 153rb-161vb, 168ra-175vb, 151, 182ra-196ra) I-5) Friday (fols. 196rb-216vb, 217ra-224vb, 225ra-230vb) I-6) Saturday (fols. 231ra-236vb, 237ra-242vb, 147, 243ra-245rb l.3) I-7) Sunday (fols. 245rb l. 4-248vb, 148, 249ra-254vb, 259, 258, 255, 261ra-268vb)

donors.donor: Tälawe Krǝstos is mentioned in the supplication formulas on fols. 5ra, 21vb, 31vb, 40ra, 45ra, 54va, 96ra, 104rb, 132va, 148vb, 153ra.

dcomments.dcomment: Late 17th cent. Tälawe Krǝstos is known as a contemporary of King ʾIyasu II (r. 1682-1706).

txstates.txstate:
Numerous folios are misplaced and some are missing. Other 30 leaves of the Ms. were photographed in UM-038.
The front board is missing. The back board is broken and repaired with a wire. The Ms. has been resewn; additional synthetic threads were used to strengthen the attachment of some folios (e.g., fols. 7-12, 56-61, 65-72, 116-119, 255-263). Many folios are damaged by water at the edges (fol. 1-4, 77, 123, 124, 126, 128, 130-133, 135, 140, 150, 229-232). Numerous folios are falling apart along rulings. Tears carefully amended on fol. 102.

bnothers.bnother: Small holes or tears are visible on the spine fold of the quires, close to the head and tail of the codex. Quire XII is reinforced by a parchment guard.

txfolios.txfolio: Foliation mistake: the leaf after fol. 123, which has not been foliated, has beens given number 123a.

squires.squire:
I(10/fols. 1r-10v) – II(6/fols. 11r-16v) – III(6/fols. 17r-22v) – IV(6; s.l.: 5, stub after 2; 3, stub after 3/fols. 23r-28v) – V(8/fols. 29r-36v) – VI(8/fols. 37r-44v) – VII(6/fols. 45r-50v) – VIII(6/fols. 51r-56v) – fol. 57 – fol. 58 – IX(6/fols. 59r-64v) – X(7; s.l.: 7, no stub/fol. 65r-71v) – XI(3; s.l.: 1, no stub/fols. 72r-74v) – XII(6/fols. 75r-80v) – XIII(6/fols. 81r-86v) – XIV(6/fols. 87r-92v) – fol. 93 – fol. 94 – fol. 95 – XV(6/fols. 96r-101v) – XVI(7; s.l.: 1, no stub/fols. 102r-108v) – XVII(9; s.l.: 9, no stub/fols. 109r-117v) – XVIII(6/fols. 118r-123v) – XIX(5; s.l.: 1, no stub/fols. 123ar-127v) – XX(5+1; s.l. 1, no stub; 3, no stub; 2 loose/fols. 128r-134v) – XXI(6/fols. 135r-140v) – XXII(6/fols. 141r-146v) – fol. 147 – fol. 148 – XXIII(8+2; loose leaves 3, 4/fols. 149r-158v) – XXIV(8/fols. 159r-166v) – fol. 167 – XX(8/fols. 168r-175v) – XXVI(6/fols. 176r-181v) – XXVII (8/fols. 182r-189v) – XXVIII(8/fols. 190r-197v) – XXIX(10/fols. 198r-207v) – XXX(9; s.l.: 1, no stub/fols. 208r-216v) – XXXI(8/fols. 217r-224v) – XXXII(5; s.l.: 5, no stub/fols. 225r-230v) – XXXIII(6/fols. 231r-236v) – XXXIV(6/fols. 237r-242v) – XXXV(6/fols. 243r-248v) – XXXVI(6/fols. 249r-254v) – XXXVII(2+5; loose leaves 2,3,4,5,6/fols. 255r-261v) – fol. 262 – fol. 263.
The structure of quires XX and XXI is uncertain. Leaf 2 of quire XX (fol. 136) appears to be a misplaced single folio (its counterpart can possibly be found elsewhere in the Ms.).

taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are partly visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are not visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

Ruling and pricking are partly visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

margin.info: (Fols. 147r-166v, 168r-255v, 258r-259v, 261r-263v) Text area: 10.2 x 9.5 All data for fol. 255r.

rulings.ruling:
Fols. 1r-146v, 167, 256r-257v, 260: Ruling and pricking are partly visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are not visible. Structural pricks are not visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.
Fols. 147r-166v, 168r-255v, 258r-259v, 261r-263v: Ruling and pricking are partly visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. Structural pricks are not visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

phandwritings.phandwriting: Fine and careful, in a well-trained hand.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: - Script on fols. 1r-146v, 167, 256r-257v, 260 (with 10 lines per folio) is of bigger size than on fols. 147r-166v, 168r-255v, 258r-259v, 261r-263v (12 lines per folio). - Ethiopic numeral “6” looks like "compressed" numeral “7” (fol. 55rb), but the numerals have dashes above and below.

rubrications.rubrication:
Nomina sacra; incipit of sections; numbers of the sections; various appellations for Mary and callings, e.g., ዕፀ (ወይን), ኦኬ, እዌድሰኪ; names of the days of the week on fols. 40ra and 96ra; elements of the punctuation signs; Ethiopic numerals.
On fols. 1r-146v, 167, 256r-257v, 260 usually 3-4 lines of the incipits are rubricated, while on fols. 147r-166v, 168r-255v, 258r-259v, 261r-263v usually only the name ማሪያም.

otherdetails.otherdetail: The original sequence of folios has been reconstructed on the basis of the edition P. LEANDER, ʼArgānōna Ŭeddāsē, Leipzig 1922 (following its division: the days of the week, sections (IX, X...), pages, lines and a subsequent word from the beginning of the line). <ለወጢነ፡ አጽሕፎ፡ ውዳሴሃ>Fol. 130-133: Mon. I, p. 7, l.4/2 – Mon. II, p. 9, l.2/7 <ኢይረክቦ፡ አፈ፡ ኰያንውኒ> Fol. 1: Mon. II, p. 10, l.2/5 – p.10, l. 13/8 Fol. 2: Mon. IV, p. 13, l.13/3 – l.24/2 Fol. 260: Mon. IV, p. 13, l. 24/3 – p. 14, l. 7/4 Fol. 3 -16: Mon. IV, p. 14, l. 7/5 – Mon. VIII, p.20, l. 24/1 Fol. 167: Mon. VIII, p. 20, l. 24/2 – p. 21, l.10/4 <የ፡ ዚአሁ፡ ወሰማይኒ፡ ተሰቅለ፡ በእንቲአሁ…> <…ዘፍጡር፡ ወግቡር>Fol. 17-22: Mon. IX, p. 22, l. 3/7 – Mon. IX, p. 25, l. 1/5 Fol. 23-28: Mon. IX, p. 25, l. 21/8 – Mon. X, p. 28, l.20/5 Fol. 95: Mon. X, p. 28, l. 20/6 – p. 29, l. 8/6 Fol. 29-50: Mon. X, p. 29, l. 8/7 – Tu. XVI, p. 39, l. 18/3 Fol. 51-64: Tu. XVI, p. 40, l.16/5 – Tu. XIX, p. 47, l. 14/5 Fol. 65-71: Tu. XX, p. 48, l. 13/2 – Tu. XXI, p. 51, l.21/7 Fol. 72-74: Tu. XXI, p. 52, l. 17/7 – Tu. XXI, p. 53, l. 25/3 Fol. 75: Tu. XXI, p. 55, l. 6/3 – l. 14/7 Fol. 76-79: Tu. XXI, p.55, l. 25/1 – Tu. XXIIl, p. 57, l.15/1 Fol. 80-81: Tu. XXIII, p. 58, l. 5/1 - Tu. XXIV, l.20/1 Fol. 82-85: Tu. XXIV, p. 59, l.12/6 – Tu. XXVI, p. 61, l.5/4 Fol. 86-92: Tu. XXVI, p. 61, l. 14/7 – Wed. XXVII, p. 65, l. 5/6 Fol. 93: Wed. XXVII, p. 65, l. 15/4 – p. 66, l.6/4 Fol. 96-101: Wed. XXVII, p. 66, l. 6/5 – Wed. XXIX, p. 68, l. 22/4 Fol. 102-108: Wed. XXIX, p. 69, l.9/5 – p. 72, l. 9/7 Fol. 109-127: Wed. XXIX, p. 72, l.19/5 – Wed. XXXIV, p. 82, l. 15/3 Fol. 128: Wed. XXXVI, p. 83, l.5/3 – l. 14/4 Fol. 134-140: Wed. XXXVI, p. 83, l. 14/5 - Wed. XXXVII, p. 86, l. 17/2 Fol. 94: Wed. XXXVII, p. 86, l.17/3 – p. 87, l. 3/6 <ጽዱላን፡ እለ፡እንበለ፡ጥፍአት…> Fol. 141-146: Wed. XXXVIII, p. 87, l.13/5 – p. 89, l. 21/1 <ወሣልስ፡ገጹ፡ ዘላህም...> <…ኢተኀልዩ፡ ንዴተ፡ ዚአየ፡ ኀልዩ፡ ዕበየ>Fol. 149-150: Wed. XXXVIII p. 90, l. 9/3 - p. 91, l. 11/2 Fol. 153-161: Wed. XXXVIII, p. 91, l. 11/3 – Thur. XLIII, p. 100, l.14/7 Fol. 168-175: Thur. XLIII, p. 100, l. 14/8 – p. 105, l.6/1 <ወአውቀየ፡ ድማሖ፡ በሰይፈ…> Fol. 176-181: Thur. XLIII, p. 105, l. 21/5 – p. 109, l. 15/1 Fol. 151: Thur. XLIII, p. 109, l.15/2 – p.110, l.6/6 Fol. 182-216: Thur. XLIII, p. 110, l. 7/1 – Fr. L, p. 133, l. 17/4 <…ፈቅድ፡ ገቢረ፡ ትእዛዙ...> Fol. 217-224: Fr. LII, p. 134, l. 10/3 – Fr. LIV, p. 139, l. 24/6 <…ዕይንትየ ክበደ፡ ድቃስ…> <…ነገረ፡ ዘርቅ፡ ወነገረ> Fol. 225-230: Fr. LIV, p. 140, l. 15/3 - Fr. LIV, p. 144, l.16/8 <ኢትግበር፡ ዘንተ፡ፍዳ…> Fol. 231-236: Sat. LVI, p. 146, l.2/4 – Sat. LVI, p. 149, l. 22/3 <ይጽንሑኪ፡ መላእክተ፡ ጽልመት…> <…ወእምአድባረ፡ አናምርት፡ወእም…> Fol. 237-242: Sat. LVI, p. 151, l. 5/1 – p. 154, l.19/7 <...ናገር፡ ውዳሴ፡ዚአኪ:: ለምንትኬ ...> Fol. 147: Sat. LVI, p. 155, l. 10/4 – p. 156, l.3/3 Fol. 243-248: Sat. LVI, p. 156, l.3/4 – Sun LVII, p. 160, l. 9/2 Fol. 148: Sun. LVII, p. 160, l. 9/3 – l. 22/6 Fol. 249-254: Sun. LVIII, p. 161, l. 14/6 – p. 166, l.1/4 Fol. 259: Sun. LVIII, p. 166, l.1/5 – l.16/6 Fol. 258: Sun. LVIII, p. 166, l.16/7 – p. 167, l.9/1 Fol. 255: Sun. LVIII, p. 167, l.9/2 – l.24/7 Fol. 261-263: Sun. LVIII, p. 167, l.24/8 – p.170, l.1/1 Fol. 129: <…ው፡ በውስተ፡ ገድል>, <እምኀበ፡ ሰብእ፡ ወመ…> Fol. 152 ? Fol. 256 ? Fol. 257 ? The proper place of fols. 129, 152, 256, 257 has not been identified yet. The division into the daily readings was introduced some time after the production of the Ms. It seems to differ slightly from the division in P. LEANDER, ʼArgānōna Ŭeddāsē, Leipzig 1922. The division into the Saturday and Sunday readings is introduced according to the division in P. Leander.

extras.extra:
- A passage on fol. 14ra was probably written in a different hand.
- Corrections are written over erased words/passages of the text, in the main hand: fols. 13vb, 35vab, 44ra, 44va, 49va, 51rb, 98rb, 99ra, 107ra, 111ra. - Ethiopic numerals written in the intercolumn: fols. 114r, 121r, 236r, 237, 238, 239, 250, 259. - Writing exercises, in pencil and in pen: fols. 18r, 70v, 71r, 101v, 102r, 160r, 171r. - Supplication formulas crudely written in angular script: fols. 5ra, 21vb, 31vb, 40ra, 45ra, 54va, 96ra, 104rb, 132va, 148vb, 153ra.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - The text is divided into sections by means of rubrication and Ethiopic numerals written in the margins: Fol. 5ra: ፯ Fol. 11rb: ፰ Fol. 18vb: ፲ Fol. 25rb: ፲፬ Fol. 27ra: ፲፭ Fol. 31vb: ፲፯ Fol. 34vb: ፲፯ Fol. 40ra: ፲፰ Fol. 45ra: ፳፩ Fol. 47va: ፳፪ Fol. 49vb: ፳፫ Fol. 51ra: ፳፬ Fol. 54va: ፳፭ Fol. 55rb: ፳፯ Fol. 57va: ፳፯ Fol. 58ra: ፳፰ Fol. 61rb: ፳፱ Fol. 62ra: ፴ Fol. 69ra: ፴፫ Fol. 76vb: ፴፯ Fol. 79ra: ፴፯ Fol. 131vb: ፪ Fol. 167ra: ፱. - Names of the days of the week indicating the readings: - ዘሠሉስ: fol 40ra - ዘረብዑ: fol. 96ra - ዘሐሙስ ምንባብ: fol. 153rb (crudely written in black ink, added later) - ዘዓርብ ምንባብ: fol. 196rb (crudely written in black ink, added later).
